filmography.title: Duck Soup
filmography.role: Rufus T. Firefly (Groucho), Pinky (Harpo), Chicolini (Chico), Lt. Bob Roland (Zeppo)
filmography.role_description: The incompetent leader of Freedonia and his chaotic spies who lead the country into war with neighboring Sylvania.
filmography.plot: Rufus T. Firefly is named president of the bankrupt country of Freedonia and declares war on neighboring Sylvania over the love of a wealthy benefactor.

filmography.title: A Night at the Opera
filmography.role_description: A fast-talking business manager and his anarchic cohorts who sabotage a snobbish opera production to help a young couple.
filmography.plot: A sly business manager and two eccentric friends try to help two opera singers achieve success while humiliating their stuffy rivals.

filmography.title: Animal Crackers
filmography.role: Captain Spaulding (Groucho), The Professor (Harpo), Signor Emanuel Ravelli (Chico), Horatio Jamison (Zeppo)
filmography.role_description: A celebrated African explorer who creates chaos at a high-society party while searching for a stolen painting.
filmography.plot: Mayhem ensues when a celebrated explorer attends a party in his honor and a valuable painting goes missing.

filmography.title: A Day at the Races
filmography.role: Dr. Hugo Z. Hackenbush (Groucho), Stuffy (Harpo), Tony (Chico)
filmography.role_description: A horse veterinarian posing as a human doctor who teams up with a jockey and a con man to save a sanitarium.
filmography.plot: A veterinarian posing as a doctor, a racehorse owner, and his friends struggle to keep a sanitarium open with the help of a misfit racehorse.

filmography.title: Horse Feathers
filmography.role: Professor Quincy Adams Wagstaff (Groucho), Pinky (Harpo), Baravelli (Chico), Frank Wagstaff (Zeppo)
filmography.role_description: The new president of Huxley College who tries to win a football game against a rival school by recruiting two inept icemen.
filmography.plot: The new president of a college attempts to upgrade the school's football team but accidentally recruits a bootlegger and a dog catcher.

filmography.title: Monkey Business
filmography.role_description: Four stowaways on a luxury liner who run amok, evading the crew and getting involved with rival gangsters.
filmography.plot: Four stowaways on a ship to America get involved with two gangsters and the captain's daughter.
filmography.awards: First Original Screenplay for the Team

filmography.title: The Cocoanuts
filmography.role_description: The owner of a bankrupt hotel in Florida who tries to swindle guests while dealing with a jewel theft.
filmography.plot: The owner of a worthless hotel in Florida tries to auction off land while a jewel thief operates on the premises.

filmography.title: Room Service
filmography.role: Gordon Miller (Groucho), Faker Englund (Harpo), Harry Binelli (Chico)
filmography.role_description: A cash-strapped theatrical producer and his assistants who try to avoid eviction from their hotel while waiting for a backer.
filmography.plot: A producer and his friends try to stay in their hotel room without paying the bill until they can secure funding for their play.

filmography.title: At the Circus
filmography.role_description: An attorney and two circus hands who try to save a circus from bankruptcy and recover stolen money.
filmography.plot: The Marx Brothers help the owner of a circus recover $10,000 stolen by a crooked manager.

filmography.title: Go West
filmography.role: S. Quentin Quale (Groucho), Rusty Pancho (Harpo), Joseph Pancho (Chico)
filmography.role_description: Three bumbling wanderers who head west and try to help a couple retrieve a stolen deed to a gold mine.
filmography.plot: The Marx Brothers head west to find their fortune and end up helping a couple who have been cheated out of their land.

filmography.title: The Big Store
filmography.role_description: A detective and his assistants who are hired to protect the heir to a department store from a crooked manager.
filmography.plot: A detective is hired to protect the life of a singer who has inherited a department store.

filmography.title: A Night in Casablanca
filmography.role_description: The new manager of a hotel in Casablanca and his staff who uncover a plot by escaping Nazis to find hidden treasure.
filmography.plot: The manager of a hotel in post-war Casablanca uncovers a plot by Nazi war criminals to recover stolen treasure.

filmography.title: Love Happy
filmography.role: Sam Grunion (Groucho), Harpo, Faustino the Great (Chico)
filmography.role_description: A detective who narrates the story of a mute clown and his friends getting mixed up in a diamond heist.
filmography.plot: A detective investigates the theft of a diamond necklace, which has ended up in a tin of sardines belonging to a troupe of struggling actors.

filmography.title: The Story of Mankind
filmography.role: Peter Minuit (Groucho), Sir Isaac Newton (Harpo), Monk (Chico)
filmography.role_description: Various historical figures played by the brothers in separate segments of this fantasy film about the history of humanity.
filmography.plot: The Spirit of Mankind and the Devil argue over whether humanity is worth saving, using examples from history.
filmography.awards: Final Film Featuring All Three Brothers

filmography.title: Copacabana
filmography.role_description: A theatrical agent who books his only client, Carmen Miranda, into two different jobs at the same nightclub.
filmography.plot: An agent has his client pose as both a French chanteuse and a Brazilian bombshell to work two jobs at the Copacabana club.

filmography.title: Double Dynamite
filmography.role_description: A helpful waiter who gives questionable advice to a bank teller who has just saved a gangster's life.
filmography.plot: A bank teller saves a gangster's life and is given a large sum of money, but he can't spend it because he's suspected of bank robbery.
filmography.awards: Co-starring Frank Sinatra and Jane Russell

filmography.title: A Girl in Every Port
filmography.role_description: A Navy sailor who, along with his shipmate, buys a racehorse with a bad leg hoping to make a fortune.
filmography.plot: Two sailors spend their shore leave trying to hide the fact that they have bought a lame racehorse.

filmography.title: Skidoo
filmography.role_description: A reclusive, powerful mob boss named 'God' who runs a crime syndicate from a yacht; Groucho's final film role.
filmography.plot: A retired hitman is called back for one last job by a mob boss named God, leading to a bizarre LSD-fueled adventure.

filmography.title: Too Many Kisses
filmography.role_description: A minor comedic role in a silent film; Harpo's screen debut and the only silent film where he speaks (though silent).
filmography.plot: A young man is sent to the Basque country by his father to break up a romance, where he encounters local rivalries.

filmography.title: Stage Door Canteen
filmography.role_description: Harpo appears as himself in a cameo, entertaining the troops in this star-studded WWII morale booster.
filmography.plot: A soldier on leave in New York City visits the famous Stage Door Canteen, meeting celebrities and finding romance.

filmography.title: Mr. Music
filmography.role_description: Groucho appears as himself in a cameo, engaging in witty banter with Bing Crosby.
filmography.plot: A Broadway producer tries to get a lazy songwriter to finish his latest show by hiring a secretary to keep him working.

filmography.title: The Incredible Jewel Robbery
filmography.role_description: Harpo and Chico team up as inept jewel thieves in this television episode, with a surprise cameo by Groucho.
filmography.plot: Two silent criminals attempt to rob a jewel store, leading to a silent comedy of errors.

filmography.title: Humor Risk
filmography.role: The Detective (Groucho), Watson (Harpo), Street Italian (Chico), The Villain (Zeppo)
filmography.role_description: The Marx Brothers' first film, a silent comedy that was never released and is now considered lost.
filmography.plot: A detective tracks a villain through a cabaret in this lost silent comedy short.

filmography.title: The Mikado
filmography.role_description: Groucho plays the Lord High Executioner in this television adaptation of the Gilbert and Sullivan opera.
filmography.plot: The son of the Mikado of Japan flees the imperial court to escape an arranged marriage and falls in love with a maiden.

filmography.title: Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter?
filmography.role_description: A surprise uncredited cameo by Groucho as the 'Great Lover' that the main character has been waiting for.
filmography.plot: An ad man tries to get a Hollywood star to endorse a lipstick campaign, causing jealousy and chaos.
